elevator

Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • elevator.Customer

  • public class Customer
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates Customer objects to be used with Elevator objects. These are called in Main in Building class.
    Version:
    SP2 CWK 3 2014
    Author:
    Nazia Ayeni and Aymar Bell Jr.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int destinationFloor 
      private static int randomValue 
      private static int startFloor 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Customer()
      Constructs a Customer object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int getDestinationFloor()
      Returns the destination floor the customer wants to go to.
      static int getStartFloor()
      Returns the start floor the customer is waiting at.
      static void setDestinationFloor(int num)
      Sets the floor the customer wants to go to
      static int setRandom()
      Returns a randomly generated number and assigns to class variables randomValue to be used when creating Customer object.
      static void setStartFloor(int num)
      Sets the floor the customer is waiting at.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • destinationFloor

        private static int destinationFloor

      • randomValue

        private static int randomValue

      • startFloor

        private static int startFloor

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer()
        Constructs a Customer object. Assigns a random start floor and a random destination floor by calling on setRandom() to generate numbers and calling on setStartFloor() and setDestinationFloor.

    • Method Detail

      • setStartFloor

        public static void setStartFloor(int num)
        Sets the floor the customer is waiting at. Floor 13 does not exist so if 13 is generated it is increased by one.
        Parameters:
        num - assigned to startFloor

      • getStartFloor

        public static int getStartFloor()
        Returns the start floor the customer is waiting at.
        Returns:
        int startFloor

      • setDestinationFloor

        public static void setDestinationFloor(int num)
        Sets the floor the customer wants to go to
        Parameters:
        num - assigned to destinationFloor

      • getDestinationFloor

        public static int getDestinationFloor()
        Returns the destination floor the customer wants to go to.
        Returns:
        int destinatonFloor

      • setRandom

        public static int setRandom()
        Returns a randomly generated number and assigns to class variables randomValue to be used when creating Customer object. The number does not exceed the numOfFloors from Building class.
        Returns:
        int randomValue
